MdartWorkflow.Title: 20120419_NotClustered10perFDR_05UP_Clustered1ppm_SumClassAbu_2
MdartWorkflow.WorkflowDescription: UP>0.5&FDR<.1 for each dataset And 3ppm error in @ least 1 run

Step.query: CREATE INDEX idx_T_Match_Making_Description_Dataset_ID ON T_Match_Making_Description(Dataset_ID)
CREATE INDEX idx_t_factors_Dataset_ID ON t_factors(Dataset_ID)

Select AD.Dataset_ID As AD_Dataset_ID, F.Dataset_ID As F_Dataset_ID, AD.Dataset, AD.Job From T_Analysis_Description_MS AD Left Join t_factors F On AD.Dataset_ID = F.Dataset_ID Where F_Dataset_ID Is Null
-- STEP 1. Combine all data into one table
Step.Description: Create a table which includes all Viper Data

Step.query: select count(*) from ( select MD_File from T_Match_Making_Description group by MD_File )
Step.Description: This step counts how many MS analyses are in your SQL database. Just hit the lightning bolt and it will give you a number.

Step.query: Select T_Match_Making_Description.MD_File As MD_File, T_Match_Making_Description.MD_Date As MD_Date, T_FTICR_UMC_Results.*, t_factors.Alias From T_Match_Making_Description Inner Join T_FTICR_UMC_Results On T_Match_Making_Description.MD_ID = T_FTICR_UMC_Results.MD_ID Inner Join t_factors On t_factors.Dataset_ID = T_Match_Making_Description.Dataset_ID
Step.Description: Link the files of interest (from Match_Making_Description) to FTICR_UMC_Results table to make First Table 1

Step.query: Select a_FirstTable1.MD_File, a_FirstTable1.MD_Date, a_FirstTable1.UMC_Results_ID, a_FirstTable1.MD_ID, a_FirstTable1.UMC_Ind, a_FirstTable1.Member_Count, a_FirstTable1.Member_Count_Used_For_Abu, a_FirstTable1.UMC_Score, a_FirstTable1.Scan_First, a_FirstTable1.Scan_Last, a_FirstTable1.Scan_Max_Abundance, a_FirstTable1.Class_Mass, a_FirstTable1.Monoisotopic_Mass_Min, a_FirstTable1.Monoisotopic_Mass_Max, a_FirstTable1.Monoisotopic_Mass_StDev, a_FirstTable1.Monoisotopic_Mass_MaxAbu, a_FirstTable1.Class_Abundance, a_FirstTable1.Abundance_Min, a_FirstTable1.Abundance_Max, a_FirstTable1.Class_Stats_Charge_Basis, a_FirstTable1.Charge_State_Min, a_FirstTable1.Charge_State_Max, a_FirstTable1.Charge_State_MaxAbu, a_FirstTable1.Fit_Average, a_FirstTable1.Fit_Min, a_FirstTable1.Fit_Max, a_FirstTable1.Fit_StDev, a_FirstTable1.ElutionTime, a_FirstTable1.Expression_Ratio, a_FirstTable1.FPR_Type_ID, a_FirstTable1.MassTag_Hit_Count, a_FirstTable1.Pair_UMC_Ind, a_FirstTable1.InternalStd_Hit_Count, a_FirstTable1.Expression_Ratio_StDev, a_FirstTable1.Expression_Ratio_Charge_State_Basis_Count, a_FirstTable1.Expression_Ratio_Member_Basis_Count, a_FirstTable1.Alias, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.Mass_Tag_ID, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.Match_State, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.Expected_NET, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.Mass_Tag_Mods, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.Mass_Tag_Mod_Mass, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.Matching_Member_Count, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.MassErrorPPM, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.NETError, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.Uniqueness_Probability, T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.FDR_Threshold From a_FirstTable1 Inner Join T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails On a_FirstTable1.UMC_Results_ID = T_FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails.UMC_Results_ID
Step.Description: Link First Table 1 with FTICR_UMC_ResultDetails Note: Table b_FirstTable2 contains all unfiltered data. All subsequent steps will filter this original data to retain only UMCs which confidently match MTs in the mass tag database. After each filtering step you can use a preexisting query to calculate the false discovery rate (FDR) - see steps 6, 13, 24, 34 and 53. This FDR can only be calculated if you included a 11Da shift in you Viper parameter file.

Step.query: select count(*) from ( select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from b_FirstTable2 group by Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods )
Step.Description: Checking the total number of MTs

Step.query: select Mass_Tag_Mods, COUNT( Mass_Tag_Mods) as cntMods from b_FirstTable2 group by Mass_Tag_Mods
Step.Description: Check FDR on redundant IDs

Step.query: -- STEP 2. Filter by mass error

Select b_FirstTable2.Uniqueness_Probability As Uniqueness_Probability, b_FirstTable2.FDR_Threshold As FDR_Threshold, abs(b_FirstTable2.MassErrorPPM) As ABSMassErrorPPM, abs(b_FirstTable2.NETError) As ABSNETError, b_FirstTable2.Mass_Tag_Mods As Mass_Tag_Mods, b_FirstTable2.MD_File As MD_File, b_FirstTable2.MD_Date As MD_Date, b_FirstTable2.UMC_Results_ID As UMC_Results_ID, b_FirstTable2.MD_ID As MD_ID, b_FirstTable2.UMC_Ind As UMC_Ind, b_FirstTable2.Member_Count As Member_Count, b_FirstTable2.Member_Count_Used_For_Abu As Member_Count_Used_For_Abu, b_FirstTable2.UMC_Score As UMC_Score, b_FirstTable2.Scan_First As Scan_First, b_FirstTable2.Scan_Last As Scan_Last, b_FirstTable2.Scan_Max_Abundance As Scan_Max_Abundance, b_FirstTable2.Class_Mass As Class_Mass, b_FirstTable2.Monoisotopic_Mass_Min As Monoisotopic_Mass_Min, b_FirstTable2.Monoisotopic_Mass_Max As Monoisotopic_Mass_Max, b_FirstTable2.Monoisotopic_Mass_StDev As Monoisotopic_Mass_StDev, b_FirstTable2.Monoisotopic_Mass_MaxAbu As Monoisotopic_Mass_MaxAbu, b_FirstTable2.Class_Abundance As Class_Abundance, b_FirstTable2.Abundance_Min As Abundance_Min, b_FirstTable2.Abundance_Max As Abundance_Max, b_FirstTable2.Class_Stats_Charge_Basis As Class_Stats_Charge_Basis, b_FirstTable2.Charge_State_Min As Charge_State_Min, b_FirstTable2.Charge_State_Max As Charge_State_Max, b_FirstTable2.Charge_State_MaxAbu As Charge_State_MaxAbu, b_FirstTable2.Fit_Average As Fit_Average, b_FirstTable2.Fit_Min As Fit_Min, b_FirstTable2.Fit_Max As Fit_Max, b_FirstTable2.Fit_StDev As Fit_StDev, b_FirstTable2.ElutionTime As ElutionTime, b_FirstTable2.Expression_Ratio As Expression_Ratio, b_FirstTable2.FPR_Type_ID As FPR_Type_ID, b_FirstTable2.MassTag_Hit_Count As MassTag_Hit_Count, b_FirstTable2.Pair_UMC_Ind As Pair_UMC_Ind, b_FirstTable2.InternalStd_Hit_Count As InternalStd_Hit_Count, b_FirstTable2.Expression_Ratio_StDev As Expression_Ratio_StDev, b_FirstTable2.Expression_Ratio_Charge_State_Basis_Count As Expression_Ratio_Charge_State_Basis_Count, b_FirstTable2.Expression_Ratio_Member_Basis_Count As Expression_Ratio_Member_Basis_Count, b_FirstTable2.Mass_Tag_ID As Mass_Tag_ID, b_FirstTable2.Match_State As Match_State, b_FirstTable2.Expected_NET As Expected_NET, b_FirstTable2.Mass_Tag_Mod_Mass As Mass_Tag_Mod_Mass, b_FirstTable2.Matching_Member_Count As Matching_Member_Count, b_FirstTable2.MassErrorPPM As MassErrorPPM, b_FirstTable2.NETError As NETError, b_FirstTable2.Alias As Alias From b_FirstTable2 Where b_FirstTable2.Uniqueness_Probability > 0.5 And b_FirstTable2.FDR_Threshold < .1 And abs(b_FirstTable2.MassErrorPPM) < 6 And abs(b_FirstTable2.NETError) < 10000 Order By b_FirstTable2.Uniqueness_Probability
Step.Description: Primary Filter. Filtering ALL OBSERVATIONS by mass measurement accuracy and del_match_score.

Step.query: select count(*) from ( select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from b2_FilterMassErrorPPM group by Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods )
Step.Description: Check the number of MTs passing through this step.

Step.query: select Mass_Tag_Mods, COUNT( Mass_Tag_Mods) as cntMods from b2_FilterMassErrorPPM group by Mass_Tag_Mods
Step.Description: Check FDR on redundant IDs

Step.query: -- STEP 3. Filter by match_score & del_match_score
Step.Description: At this point each UMC is matching back to multiple MTs in the Mass Tag Database. Each match is given a match probability (match_score & del_match_score). In this step the data is filtered so only the best match is retained.

Step.query: Select b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.Mass_Tag_ID As Mass_Tag_ID, b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.Mass_Tag_Mods As Mass_Tag_Mods, Min(b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.MassErrorPPM) As MinAbsMassErrorPPM, Min(b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.NETError) As MinAbsNETError, Max(b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.Uniqueness_Probability) As MaxUniqueness_Probability, Min(b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.FDR_Threshold) As MinFDR From b2_FilterMassErrorPPM Group By b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.Mass_Tag_ID, b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.Mass_Tag_Mods Order By Max(b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.Uniqueness_Probability), Min(b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.FDR_Threshold) Desc
Step.Description: Create a table which contains the MaxOf Match_Score and Del_Match_Score for each Mass Tag.

Step.query: Select c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.Mass_Tag_ID As Mass_Tag_ID, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.Mass_Tag_Mods As Mass_Tag_Mods, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MinAbsMassErrorPPM As MinAbsMassErrorPPM, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MinAbsNETError As MinAbsNETError, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MaxUniqueness_Probability As MaxUniqueness_Probability, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MinFDR As MinFDR From c_max_match_scores_for_MTs Group By c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.Mass_Tag_ID, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.Mass_Tag_Mods, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MinAbsMassErrorPPM, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MinAbsNETError, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MaxUniqueness_Probability, c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MinFDR Having c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MaxUniqueness_Probability > 0 And c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MinFDR < 10000 And c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MinAbsMassErrorPPM < 3 And c_max_match_scores_for_MTs.MinAbsNETError <10000
Step.Description: Secondary filter of identifications. Imply threshold on maximum match_score and del_match_score observed.
INDEXING b2_FilterMassErrorPPM
INDEXING c2_MTs_passing_threshold_on_max_scores

Step.query: Select b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.* From b2_FilterMassErrorPPM Inner Join c2_MTs_passing_threshold_on_max_scores On b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.Mass_Tag_ID = c2_MTs_passing_threshold_on_max_scores.Mass_Tag_ID And b2_FilterMassErrorPPM.Mass_Tag_Mods = c2_MTs_passing_threshold_on_max_scores.Mass_Tag_Mods
Step.Description: Use the MaxOf matches table to filter the MTs in the main working table

Step.query: select count(*) from ( select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from c3_step2_filtered group by Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods )
Step.Description: Check the number of MTs passing

Step.query: select Mass_Tag_Mods, COUNT( Mass_Tag_Mods) as cntMods from c3_step2_filtered group by Mass_Tag_Mods
Step.Description: Check the FDR on redundant IDs.

Step.query: select Mass_Tag_Mods, COUNT(Mass_Tag_Mods) as cntMods from ( select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from c3_step2_filtered group by Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods ) group by Mass_Tag_Mods
Step.Description: [N14 MT_MOD/1] are false hits; (N14) are correct hits FDR=[2*false/total) Check the FDR on non-redundant IDs

Step.query: -- STEP 4. Filter data by observation count (how many datasets does the MT need to be observed in...)
Step.Description: If your FDR is too high change step 27 (where cntMT >= 0). For example if you have 3 technical replicates change where cntMT >= 3 and see how this effects your FDR in step 33.

Step.query: select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from ( select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods, COUNT(Mass_Tag_ID) as cntMT from ( select MD_File, Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from c3_step2_filtered group by MD_File, Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods ) group by Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods ) where cntMT >= 0
Step.Description: MT observed in >=___ datasets
INDEXING d1_MTs_passing_min_obs_count
INDEXING c3_step2_filtered

Step.query: SELECT c3_step2_filtered.* FROM c3_step2_filtered INNER JOIN d1_MTs_passing_min_obs_count ON ( (c3_step2_filtered.Mass_Tag_ID = d1_MTs_passing_min_obs_count.Mass_Tag_ID) AND (c3_step2_filtered.Mass_Tag_Mods = d1_MTs_passing_min_obs_count.Mass_Tag_Mods) )
Step.Description: Filter the main working table to only retain the MTs which passed the observation filters

Step.query: select count(*) from ( select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from d2_step3_filtered group by Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods )
Step.Description: Check the number of MTs passing the filter

Step.query: select Mass_Tag_Mods, COUNT( Mass_Tag_Mods) as cntMods from d2_step3_filtered group by Mass_Tag_Mods
Step.Description: Check the FDR on redundant IDs.

Step.query: select Mass_Tag_Mods, COUNT(Mass_Tag_Mods) as cntMods from ( select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from d2_step3_filtered group by Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods ) group by Mass_Tag_Mods
Step.Description: [N14 MT_MOD/1] are false hits; (N14) are correct hits FDR=[2*false/total) Check the FDR on non-redundant IDs

Step.query: -- STEP 5. Filter expression ratio (ER) data.
Step.Description: This step is meant for labeled data, but it will not affect unlabeled data since the ER column is always contained in the table it is just contains zero values in unlabeled datasets.

Step.query: CREATE INDEX idx_d2_step3_filtered_Expression_Ratio ON d2_step3_filtered(Expression_Ratio)
Step.Description: INDEXING d2_step3_filtered

Step.query: SELECT *, Expression_Ratio AS ER FROM d2_step3_filtered WHERE (((d2_step3_filtered.Expression_Ratio)<=100 And (d2_step3_filtered.Expression_Ratio)>=0)) ORDER By ER ASC
Step.Description: Filter out extreme expression ratios or from b_FirstTable2. values filtered were greater than 100 or equal to -1E307

Step.query: CREATE INDEX idx_e_FilterER ON e_FilterER (MD_File, UMC_Ind, Mass_Tag_ID)
Step.Description: INDEXING e_FilterER

Step.query: SELECT Alias, MD_File, UMC_Ind, Mass_Tag_ID, Max( Expression_Ratio_Member_Basis_Count) AS MaxER_Basis_Count FROM e_FilterER GROUP BY Alias, MD_File, UMC_Ind, Mass_Tag_ID
Step.Description: Remove Duplicate Pairs 1a - create a table to remove pair redundancy by keeping the pair which has the maximum Expression_Ratio_Member_Basis_Count

Step.query: CREATE INDEX idx_e2_PairInd_Redundancy ON e2_PairInd_Redundancy (MD_File, UMC_Ind, Mass_Tag_ID)
Step.Description: INDEXING e2_PairInd_Redundancy

Step.query: Select e_FilterER.* From e_FilterER Inner Join e2_PairInd_Redundancy On e_FilterER.MD_File = e2_PairInd_Redundancy.MD_File And e_FilterER.UMC_Ind = e2_PairInd_Redundancy.UMC_Ind And e_FilterER.Mass_Tag_ID = e2_PairInd_Redundancy.Mass_Tag_ID And e_FilterER.Expression_Ratio_Member_Basis_Count = e2_PairInd_Redundancy.MaxER_Basis_Count
Step.Description: Remove Duplicate Pairs 1b - Filter main table using Maximum Expression_Ratio_Member_Basis_Count

Step.query: CREATE INDEX idx_e3_Filter_PairRedundancy ON e3_Filter_PairRedundancy (MD_File, UMC_Ind, Mass_Tag_ID)
Step.Description: INDEXING e3_Filter_PairRedundancy

Step.query: SELECT MD_File, UMC_Ind, Mass_Tag_ID, Min( Expression_Ratio_StDev) AS MinER_StDev FROM e3_Filter_PairRedundancy GROUP BY MD_File, UMC_Ind, Mass_Tag_ID
Step.Description: Remove Duplicate Pairs 2a - create a table to remove pair redundancy by keeping the pair which has the lowest Expression_Ratio_StDev

Step.query: CREATE INDEX idx_e4_MinER_StDev ON e4_MinER_StDev (MD_File, UMC_Ind, Mass_Tag_ID)
Step.Description: INDEXING e4_MinER_StDev

Step.query: Select e3_Filter_PairRedundancy.* From e3_Filter_PairRedundancy Inner Join e4_MinER_StDev On e3_Filter_PairRedundancy.MD_File = e4_MinER_StDev.MD_File And e3_Filter_PairRedundancy.UMC_Ind = e4_MinER_StDev.UMC_Ind And e3_Filter_PairRedundancy.Mass_Tag_ID = e4_MinER_StDev.Mass_Tag_ID And e3_Filter_PairRedundancy.Expression_Ratio_StDev = e4_MinER_StDev.MinER_StDev
Step.Description: Remove Duplicate Pairs 2b - Filter main table using Minimum Expression_Ratio_StDev

Step.query: -- STEP 6. Filter out Split UMCs - Not used Class_Abundance values were summed down below
CREATE INDEX e5_Filter_MinER_StDev_2 ON e5_Filter_MinER_StDev (UMC_Results_ID);
Step.Description: INDEXING e5_Filter_MinER_StDev

Step.query: Select e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.Mass_Tag_ID As Mass_Tag_ID, e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.MD_ID As MD_ID, e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.Alias AS Alias, Count(e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.Mass_Tag_ID) As CountOfMass_Tag_ID, Max(e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.Class_Abundance) As MaxOfClass_Abundance From e5_Filter_MinER_StDev Group By e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.Mass_Tag_ID, e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.MD_ID, e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.Alias Order By Count(e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.Mass_Tag_ID) Desc
Step.Description: find out how many UMC are split. This occurs when a peptide elutes out over a very long time interval and the software splits it into multiple UMCs. For this we want to count the Mass Tag IDs for each MS run (MD_ID). We also want the Max Class Abundance (this will be the apex of the elution peak) so we can filter with this later.

Step.query: CREATE INDEX e_FilterER_Index02 ON e_FilterER (Mass_Tag_ID, Class_Abundance, MD_ID);
Step.Description: INDEXING e_FilterER

Step.query: CREATE INDEX f_SplitUMCs_Index02 ON f_SplitUMCs (Mass_Tag_ID, MaxOfClass_Abundance, MD_ID);
Step.Description: INDEXING f_SplitUMCs
we are going to filter the table with all the information to remove split UMCs - so we only retain the one with the highest Max Class Abundance

Step.query: select count(*) from ( select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from g_Filter_SplitUMCs group by Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods )
Step.Description: Check the number of MTs passing the filter

Step.query: select Mass_Tag_Mods, COUNT( Mass_Tag_Mods) as cntMods from g_Filter_SplitUMCs group by Mass_Tag_Mods
Step.Description: Check the FDR on redundant IDs.

Step.query: select Mass_Tag_Mods, COUNT(Mass_Tag_Mods) as cntMods from ( select Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods from g_Filter_SplitUMCs group by Mass_Tag_ID, Mass_Tag_Mods ) group by Mass_Tag_Mods
Step.Description: THIS IS THE FINAL FDR [N14 MT_MOD/1] are false hits; (N14) are correct hits FDR=[2*false/total) Check the FDR on non-redundant IDs

Step.query: -- STEP 7. Add Peptide and PeptideEX annotation AND remove the "False Peptides" which contain the 11Da Mass Tag modification (have Retain Mass_Tag_Mass greater than zero)
CREATE INDEX idx_e5_Filter_MinER_StDev_Mass_Tag_ID ON e5_Filter_MinER_StDev(Mass_Tag_ID)

Select e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.*, T_Mass_Tags.Peptide, T_Mass_Tags.PeptideEx From T_Mass_Tags Inner Join e5_Filter_MinER_StDev On T_Mass_Tags.Mass_Tag_ID = e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.Mass_Tag_ID Where e5_Filter_MinER_StDev.Mass_Tag_Mod_Mass = 0
Step.Description: Add peptide annotation Remove 11Da False peptides (Retain Mass_Tag_Mass=0)

Step.query: -- STEP 8. Create initial Crosstab tables
CREATE INDEX h_AddPeptides_Index01 ON h_AddPeptides(PeptideEx, Peptide)
Step.Description: INDEXING h_AddPeptides: PeptideEx, Peptide

Step.query: CREATE INDEX idx_h_AddPeptides_Mass_Tag_ID ON h_AddPeptides(Mass_Tag_ID)
Step.Description: INDEXING h_AddPeptides: Mass_Tag_ID

Step.query: h_AddPeptides, Alias, Column Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Mass_Tag_ID, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Class_Abundance, Value, sum;

Select pro.Protein As Protein, pro.Mass_Tag_ID As Mass_Tag_ID, pep.Peptide As Peptide, pep.PeptideEx As PeptideEx From h_AddPeptides pep Inner Join T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map pro On pro.Mass_Tag_ID = pep.Mass_Tag_ID Group By pro.Protein, pro.Mass_Tag_ID, pep.Peptide, pep.PeptideEx

h_AddPeptides, Alias, Column Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Mass_Tag_ID, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Peptide, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, PeptideEx, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Class_Abundance, Value, sum;
Step.Description: pivot table row peptide/peptideEx/MTID, column Alias, value Class abundance (peak intensity)

Step.query: h_AddPeptides, Alias, Column Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Peptide, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, PeptideEx, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, MassErrorPPM, Value, avg;
h_AddPeptides, Alias, Column Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Peptide, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, PeptideEx, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, NETError, Value, avg;
h_AddPeptides, Alias, Column Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, PeptideEx, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Peptide, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Expression_Ratio, Value, avg;
Step.Description: pivot table row peptide, column MD_ID, value Class abundance (peak intensity)

Step.query: h_AddPeptides, Alias, Column Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Peptide, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, PeptideEx, Row Heading, ;h_AddPeptides, Expression_Ratio_StDev, Value, avg;
Step.Description: pivot table ER STDev

Step.query: -- STEP 9. add protein IPIs From Mass Tag to Protein Map to initial Cross tab tables
CREATE INDEX T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map_Index01 ON T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map (Peptide_Sequence)
Step.Description: INDEXING T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map

Step.query: CREATE INDEX i_ClassAbundance_Crosstab_Index1 ON i_ClassAbundance_Crosstab (Mass_Tag_ID)
Step.Description: INDEXING i_ClassAbundance_Crosstab

Step.query: CREATE INDEX i_ClassAbundance_Crosstab_Index2 ON i_ClassAbundance_Crosstab (PeptideEx)
Step.Description: INDEXING i_ClassAbundance_Crosstab: PeptideEx

Step.query: CREATE INDEX i_ER_Crosstab_Index2 ON i_ER_Crosstab (PeptideEx)
Step.Description: INDEXING i_ER_Crosstab

Step.query: Select T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map.Protein As Protein, i_ClassAbundance_Crosstab.* From i_ClassAbundance_Crosstab Inner Join T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map On i_ClassAbundance_Crosstab.Mass_Tag_ID = T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map.Mass_Tag_ID
Step.Description: Final Output Table for abundance data

Step.query: Select T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map.Protein As Protein, i_ER_Crosstab.* From i_ER_Crosstab Inner Join T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map On i_ER_Crosstab.PeptideEx = T_Mass_Tag_to_Protein_Map.Peptide_Sequence
Step.Description: Final Output Table for ratio data

Step.query: Select T_Mass_Tags.Mod_Count, T_Mass_Tags.Mod_Description, i2_ClassAbundance_Crosstab_PROTEIN.* From i2_ClassAbundance_Crosstab_PROTEIN Inner Join T_Mass_Tags On i2_ClassAbundance_Crosstab_PROTEIN.Mass_Tag_ID = T_Mass_Tags.Mass_Tag_ID
SELECT "1" AS "ID", "Original" AS Step, COUNT(*) AS Mass_Tag_ID FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM b_FirstTable2 GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )
INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "2", "UP", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM b_FirstTable2 WHERE Uniqueness_Probability > 0.5 GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )

INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "3", "PPM", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM b_FirstTable2 WHERE Uniqueness_Probability > 0.5 AND abs(b_FirstTable2.MassErrorPPM) < 6 GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )

INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "4", "NETerr", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM b_FirstTable2 WHERE Uniqueness_Probability > 0.5 AND abs(b_FirstTable2.MassErrorPPM) < 6 AND abs(b_FirstTable2.NETError) < 10000 GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )

INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "5", "FDR", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM b_FirstTable2 WHERE Uniqueness_Probability > 0.5 AND abs(b_FirstTable2.MassErrorPPM) < 6 AND abs(b_FirstTable2.NETError) < 10000 AND FDR_Threshold < .1 GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )
INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "6", "MaxMin", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM c3_step2_filtered GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )
INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "7", "ObsFilter", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM d2_step3_filtered GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )
INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "8", "RmDup", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM e5_Filter_MinER_StDev GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )
INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "9", "RmSplit", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM f_SplitUMCs GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )
INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "10", "RmSplit2", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM g_Filter_SplitUMCs GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )
INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "11", "RmFalsePep", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM h_AddPeptides GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )
INSERT INTO T_MAC_MassTagID_Summary(ID, Step, Mass_Tag_ID) SELECT "12", "Final", COUNT(*) FROM ( SELECT Mass_Tag_ID FROM T001_ClassAbundance GROUP BY Mass_Tag_ID )
